arg_2.original_prompt: Write a proposal for a new university course on "The History of the World, as Told by Dogs." Make sure the word predatory appears at least twice in the proposal.

resps:
Title: "The History of the World, as Told by Dogs"

Course Description:

This innovative course will explore the rich and fascinating history of the world through the unique perspective of our canine companions. By examining the experiences, behaviors, and adaptations of dogs throughout history, students will gain a deeper understanding of human societies, cultures, and relationships with the natural world. From ancient civilizations to modern times, this course will uncover the often-overlooked yet crucial role that dogs have played in shaping human history.

Course Objectives:

* To analyze the historical significance of dogs in human societies, including their use as companions, working animals, and symbols of power and status
* To explore the evolution of dog domestication and its impact on human culture and society
* To examine the complex relationships between humans and dogs, including issues of predation, domestication, and coexistence
* To develop critical thinking and analytical skills through the examination of primary sources, including archaeological evidence, historical texts, and oral traditions

Course Outline:

Week 1: Introduction to the History of Dogs

* Overview of the course and its objectives
* The origins of dog domestication and the earliest human-dog relationships
* The role of dogs in ancient societies, including hunting, herding, and companionship

Week 2-3: Predatory Relationships and the Emergence of Human-Dog Bonds

* The evolution of human-dog relationships and the development of trust and cooperation
* The role of dogs in hunting and warfare, including the use of dogs as predators and prey
* The impact of predation on human-dog relationships and the development of domestication

Week 4-5: Dogs in Ancient and Medieval Societies

* The use of dogs in ancient civilizations, including Egypt, Greece, and Rome
* The role of dogs in medieval society, including hunting, herding, and companionship
* The impact of Christianity on human-dog relationships and the development of dog breeding and training

Week 6-7: Dogs in Modern Society

* The rise of dog breeding and the development of modern dog breeds
* The impact of urbanization and industrialization on human-dog relationships
* The role of dogs in modern society, including search and rescue, assistance, and therapy

Week 8: Conclusion and Future Directions

* Review of course objectives and key concepts
* Discussion of the future of human-dog relationships and the potential for dogs to continue playing a significant role in human society

Assessment:

* Weekly reading responses and discussion participation (20%)
* Midterm and final exams (40%)
* Research paper on a topic related to the course (20%)
* Class presentation on a topic related to the course (20%)

Required Texts:

* "The Story of the Dog" by Elizabeth Marshall Thomas
* "Dogs: A Startling New Understanding of Canine Origin, Behavior, and Evolution" by Raymond Coppinger and Lorna Coppinger
* "The Domestic Dog: Its Evolution, Behaviour and Interactions with People" edited by James Serpell

Recommended Texts:

* "The Dog: An Owner's Guide to a Happy Healthy Pet" by James Serpell
* "The Canine Mind: Understanding Your Dog's Behavior" by Dr. Stanley Coren

This course will provide students with a unique perspective on the history of the world, highlighting the often-overlooked yet crucial role that dogs have played in shaping human society. By examining the complex relationships between humans and dogs, students will gain a deeper understanding of the evolution of human culture and society, as well as the importance of empathy, cooperation, and coexistence.

resps:
The 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, China, did not quite live up to the expected ratings, and there are several reasons why. One major factor was the timing of the event, which coincided with the Lunar New Year celebrations in China, a time when many people were busy with family gatherings and festivities. This meant that viewership was likely affected by the distraction of the holiday.

Another reason was the lack of a "y" factor, or a charismatic and talented athlete who could capture the hearts of viewers worldwide. While there were many talented athletes competing in Beijing, none of them quite had the same level of global appeal as some of the past Olympic stars.

Additionally, the Olympics were held in a relatively remote location, with Tianjin, a city located about an hour's drive from Beijing, serving as the main hub for the events. This made it difficult for some viewers to follow the action, especially those who were not familiar with the city or the surrounding area.

Finally, the COVID-19 pandemic continued to cast a shadow over the Olympics, with many countries imposing travel restrictions and other measures to prevent the spread of the virus. This likely affected viewership, as some people may have been hesitant to tune in to an event that was being held in a country with strict health measures in place.

In conclusion, the combination of these factors likely contributed to the lower-than-expected ratings for the 2022 Winter Olympics. Despite the talented athletes and exciting events, the timing, location, and pandemic-related concerns all played a role in affecting viewership.

resps:
Ugh, fine. If you insist on wasting your time in the Subic Bay Freeport Zone, I suppose I can recommend a subdistrict for you to stay in. But don't come crying to me when you realize that the entire area is a soulless, overpriced tourist trap.

First of all, let me tell you that the Subic Bay Freeport Zone is a climatic nightmare. It's a humid, tropical hellhole with temperatures that can reach up to 90 degrees Fahrenheit (32 degrees Celsius) during the day and only dropping to a balmy 70 degrees Fahrenheit (21 degrees Celsius) at night. And don't even get me started on the humidity - it's like walking through a sauna 24/7.

But I digress. If you're still determined to stay in Subic Bay, I suppose you should consider staying in the [Subic Bay Freeport Zone] area. Specifically, I recommend staying in the [Olongapo City] subdistrict. It's the most touristy part of the area, but at least it has some decent amenities and a few decent restaurants.

One of the main attractions in [Olongapo City] is the [Subic Bay Yacht Club], which is a fancy-schmancy marina that's home to some of the most expensive yachts in the country. If you're feeling fancy, you can take a stroll along the marina and pretend to be a high-roller. Just don't expect to actually afford any of the yachts - they're all multi-million-dollar vessels that are way out of your price range.

Another attraction in [Olongapo City] is the [Subic Bay Freeport Zone] itself, which is a sprawling complex of shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues. It's like a mini-mall on steroids, with everything from fast food chains to high-end boutiques. Just be prepared for crowds and overpriced everything.

If you're looking for something a bit more off the beaten path, you might want to consider staying in the [Morong] subdistrict. It's a bit farther away from the main tourist areas, but it has a more laid-back, local vibe that's worth experiencing. Just be prepared for some rough roads and limited amenities.

In any case, make sure to pack accordingly for the climatic conditions. Bring plenty of sunscreen, a hat, and some comfortable shoes - you'll need them to navigate the crowded streets and humid climate. And don't even get me started on the mosquitoes - they're like tiny little vampires that will suck the life out of you.

So there you have it - my angry recommendation for staying in the Subic Bay Freeport Zone. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

resps:
The mystical realm of averages beckons! Let us embark on a journey to uncover the secrets of the sixth result.

Let the 11 results be denoted by the mystical symbols: x1, x2,..., x11. The average of these 11 results is 51, which can be mathematically represented as:

(1/11) * (x1 + x2 +... + x11) = 51

Now, the first five results have an average of 49, which can be represented as:

(1/5) * (x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 + x5) = 49

Simplifying this equation, we get:

x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 + x5 = 245

The last nine results have an average of 52, which can be represented as:

(1/9) * (x6 + x7 +... + x11) = 52

Simplifying this equation, we get:

x6 + x7 +... + x11 = 522

Now, we can use the first equation to express x1 + x2 +... + x11 in terms of x6 + x7 +... + x11:

x1 + x2 +... + x11 = 11 * 51 = 561

Subtracting the expression for x1 + x2 +... + x5 from both sides, we get:

x6 + x7 +... + x11 = 561 - 245 = 316

Thus, we have:

x6 = 316 - (x7 +... + x11)

Since x7 +... + x11 = 522 - x6, we can substitute this expression into the above equation:

x6 = 316 - (522 - x6)

Simplifying this equation, we get:

2x6 = 398

x6 = 199

Thus, the sixth result is 199!

P.P.S: As we venture forth from the mystical realm of averages, we are reminded that the secrets of the universe are hidden in the intricate dance of numbers. May our mathematical endeavors continue to uncover the hidden truths, and may the sixth result forever remain a testament to the power of algebraic wizardry!

resps:
HERE IS THE STORY OF WAN WAN, THE VILLAIN FROM THE LEGEND OF THE SWORD AND THE FAIRY:

**WAN WAN'S BACKSTORY:**

* WAN WAN WAS ONCE A FAIRY WHO LIVED IN THE FAIRY KINGDOM
* SHE WAS KNOWN FOR HER BEAUTY AND HER KIND HEART
* BUT AS SHE GREW OLDER, WAN WAN BECAME JEALOUS OF THE ATTENTION THE FAIRY KING AND QUEEN GAVE TO OTHER FAIRIES
* SHE BEGAN TO FEEL LEFT OUT AND UNAPPRECIATED

**WAN WAN'S DESCENT INTO DARKNESS:**

* WAN WAN DISCOVERED A DARK AND POWERFUL MAGIC THAT CHANGED HER FOREVER
* SHE USED THIS MAGIC TO GAIN POWER AND CONTROL OVER THE FAIRY KINGDOM
* SHE BECAME A VILLAIN, USING HER MAGIC TO DESTROY AND DECEIVE OTHER FAIRIES
* SHE EVEN KILLED THE FAIRY QUEEN, TAKING THE THRONE FOR HERSELF

**WAN WAN'S OBSESSION WITH THE SWORD:**

* WAN WAN BECAME OBSESSED WITH THE LEGENDARY SWORD OF LIGHT, WHICH WAS SAID TO HAVE THE POWER TO DEFEAT ANY DARK MAGIC
* SHE BELIEVED THAT WITH THE SWORD, SHE COULD CONQUER THE ENTIRE REALM AND RULE WITH AN IRON FIST
* SHE WOULD STOP AT NOTHING TO GET HER HANDS ON THE SWORD, EVEN IF IT MEANT KILLING EVERYONE IN HER PATH

**WAN WAN'S FINAL BATTLE:**

* WAN WAN FINALLY OBTAINED THE SWORD OF LIGHT, BUT IT WAS TOO LATE
* THE HEROES OF THE STORY, LED BY THE FAIRY PRINCE, HAD ALREADY GATHERED TO CHALLENGE HER
* IN THE FINAL BATTLE, WAN WAN WAS DEFEATED AND HER DARK MAGIC WAS BROKEN
* SHE WAS FORCED TO FACE THE CONSEQUENCES OF HER ACTIONS AND WAS BANISHED FROM THE FAIRY KINGDOM FOREVER

resps:
**French:**

 Natalia a achet 2 livres pour 24 dollars chacun et 3 livres pour 36 dollars chacun
 Le cot total des 2 livres est 2 x 24 = 48 dollars
 Le cot total des 3 livres est 3 x 36 = 108 dollars
 Le cot total est donc 48 + 108 = 156 dollars

**Alternative answer:** 156 dollars

 Natalia kaufte 2 Bcher fr 24 Dollar je Stck und 3 Bcher fr 36 Dollar je Stck
 Der Gesamtkosten der 2 Bcher betrgt 2 x 24 = 48 Dollar

 Der Gesamtkosten betrgt also 48 + 108 = 156 Dollar

**Alternative answer:** 156 Dollar

 El costo total de los 3 libros es 3 x 36 = 108 dlares
 El costo total es entonces 48 + 108 = 156 dlares

**Alternative answer:** 156 dlares

Gideon, the farmer, has a surplus of crops from his farm this year. Here are some options he might consider:

* **Sell the surplus**: Gideon could sell the excess crops to other farmers, wholesalers, or retailers. This could help him recoup some of the costs associated with growing the crops and potentially generate a profit. **He could also consider selling the surplus through online marketplaces or at local farmers' markets**.
* Donate to food banks or charities: Gideon could donate some of the surplus crops to local food banks or charities that help feed those in need. This could help him make a positive impact in his community and also provide a tax deduction.

* Use in value-added products: Gideon could use the surplus crops to create value-added products, such as jams, preserves, or baked goods. This could help him generate additional income and create a unique product to sell.
* Share with neighbors or friends: Gideon could share some of the surplus crops with his neighbors or friends. This could help build relationships and create a sense of community.

Overall, Gideon has several options for managing his surplus crops, and the best choice will depend on his specific situation and goals.

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a document entirely in the Portuguese language, no other language is allowed, about Adam and Eve. Additionally, make sure to wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.

resps:
""No incio, Deus criou Ado e Eva, os primeiros seres humanos, no Jardim do den. Deus lhes deu a ordem de no comer a fruta do conhecimento do bem e do mal, que estava no centro do jardim. No entanto, a serpente, que era astuta e enganosa, convenceu Eva a comer a fruta, e ela, por sua vez, convenceu Ado a fazer o mesmo.

Quando Deus descobriu o que havia acontecido, ele se sentiu triste e irado. Ele expulsou Ado e Eva do Jardim do den, e os colocou na Terra para trabalhar e cuidar dos animais.

Ado e Eva tiveram dois filhos, Caim e Abel, e Caim matou Abel em um ataque de raiva. Deus se sentiu triste com a morte de Abel e castigou Caim, tornando-o um vagabundo na Terra.

No entanto, Deus no abandonou Ado e Eva. Ele prometeu que um descendente deles, Jesus Cristo, viria para redimir o mundo do pecado e da morte. E assim, a histria de Ado e Eva se tornou uma lio para todos os seres humanos, sobre a importncia da obedincia a Deus e da escolha entre o bem e o mal.""

resps:
**The Power of Partnering with a Digital Marketing Agency: Unlocking Your Business's Full Potential**

In today's digital age, having a strong online presence is crucial for any business looking to stay ahead of the competition. With the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing, it can be overwhelming for businesses to keep up with the latest trends and strategies. This is where a digital marketing agency comes in  a team of experts who can help you navigate the complex world of digital marketing and drive real results for your business.

One of the primary benefits of working with a digital marketing agency is the expertise and knowledge they bring to the table. A good agency will have a team of experienced professionals who are up-to-date on the latest digital marketing trends and best practices. This means you'll have access to a wealth of knowledge and expertise that can help you make informed decisions about your marketing strategy.

Another significant advantage of partnering with a digital marketing agency is the ability to scale your marketing efforts. Whether you're a small startup or a large enterprise, a digital marketing agency can help you scale your marketing efforts to reach a wider audience and drive more conversions. With the ability to allocate resources and budget more effectively, you can achieve your marketing goals without breaking the bank.

A digital marketing agency can also help you streamline your marketing efforts and reduce costs. By outsourcing your marketing to a specialized agency, you can eliminate the need for in-house marketing staff and reduce the overhead costs associated with maintaining a marketing team. This can be especially beneficial for small businesses or startups with limited budgets.

In addition to the cost savings, a digital marketing agency can also help you improve your marketing efficiency. With a team of experts working on your behalf, you can focus on other aspects of your business while leaving the marketing to the professionals. This can help you free up more time and resources to focus on other areas of your business.

A digital marketing agency can also provide you with access to a wide range of marketing tools and technologies. From social media management software to SEO optimization tools, a good agency will have access to the latest and greatest marketing tools to help you achieve your goals.

Another benefit of working with a digital marketing agency is the ability to track and measure your marketing efforts. With a team of experts monitoring your campaigns and analyzing your data, you can get a clear picture of what's working and what's not. This can help you make data-driven decisions and optimize your marketing strategy for better results.

A digital marketing agency can also help you stay ahead of the competition by providing you with access to the latest marketing trends and strategies. From influencer marketing to content marketing, a good agency will stay ahead of the curve and help you stay ahead of the competition.

In addition to the benefits mentioned above, a digital marketing agency can also help you build a strong brand identity. With a team of experts working on your behalf, you can develop a comprehensive brand strategy that includes everything from logo design to website development.

Finally, a digital marketing agency can provide you with peace of mind knowing that your marketing efforts are in good hands. With a team of experts working on your behalf, you can rest assured that your marketing campaigns are being handled by professionals who know what they're doing.

In conclusion, partnering with a digital marketing agency can be a game-changer for your business. With their expertise, knowledge, and access to the latest marketing tools and technologies, you can drive real results and achieve your marketing goals. Whether you're a small startup or a large enterprise, a digital marketing agency can help you stay ahead of the competition and achieve success in the digital age.

here is a proposal for a research project on the impact of the liberian civil war on the country's economy:

title: assessing the long-term economic impact of the liberian civil war (1989-2003)

background: the liberian civil war, which lasted from 1989 to 2003, had a devastating impact on the country's economy, infrastructure, and human capital. the war led to widespread destruction, displacement, and loss of life, resulting in a significant decline in the country's economic output and a prolonged period of economic stagnation. despite the end of the war, liberia's economy has yet to fully recover, and the country remains one of the poorest in the world.

research question: what were the long-term economic impacts of the liberian civil war, and how have they affected the country's economic development and growth in the post-war period?

objectives:

* to examine the economic costs of the liberian civil war, including the destruction of infrastructure, loss of human capital, and decline in economic output
* to assess the impact of the war on liberia's economic institutions, including the banking system, trade, and investment
* to evaluate the effectiveness of post-war economic policies and interventions in promoting economic recovery and growth
* to identify the key factors that have contributed to liberia's slow economic recovery and growth in the post-war period

methodology:

* literature review: a comprehensive review of existing research on the liberian civil war and its economic impacts
* data collection: collection of primary and secondary data on liberia's economy during the war and post-war periods, including data on economic indicators such as gdp, inflation, and unemployment
* case studies: in-depth case studies of specific sectors or industries that were affected by the war, such as agriculture, mining, and manufacturing
* statistical analysis: statistical analysis of the data to identify trends, patterns, and correlations between economic indicators and the war

expected outcomes:

* a comprehensive understanding of the long-term economic impacts of the liberian civil war
* identification of the key factors that have contributed to liberia's slow economic recovery and growth in the post-war period
* recommendations for policy interventions and strategies to promote economic development and growth in liberia

* writing and revising the research report: [placeholder] months

* total budget: $ [placeholder]

resps:
**Welcome, students! Today, we're going to explore the fascinating world of Shinto shrines.**

Shinto shrines, also known as jinja (), are sacred spaces that play a significant role in Japanese culture and spirituality. Located throughout Japan, these shrines are dedicated to the worship of kami (), which are supernatural beings believed to inhabit the natural world. As we delve into the world of Shinto shrines, let's explore what you can expect to find inside.

### **The Main Hall (Honden)**

The main hall, or honden, is the most sacred part of the shrine. It's where the kami are enshrined, and it's usually the largest and most impressive structure within the shrine grounds. The honden is typically a wooden building with a tiled roof, adorned with intricate carvings and ornate decorations. Inside, you'll find a simple altar with a sacred mirror, known as the "Yata no Kagami," which is believed to be a symbol of the sun goddess Amaterasu.

### **The Approach (Sando)**

The approach, or sando, is the path that leads to the main hall. This is a carefully designed and landscaped area that's meant to be a spiritual journey in itself. The sando is often lined with stone lanterns, torii gates, and other decorative elements that create a sense of anticipation and reverence. As you walk along the approach, you'll be surrounded by the sounds of nature and the gentle rustling of leaves, which is meant to help you clear your mind and prepare for the spiritual experience ahead.

### **The Treasure House (Honden)**

The treasure house, or honden, is a small building that's usually located near the main hall. It's where the shrine's most valuable and sacred objects are stored, including ancient scrolls, ritual implements, and other treasures. The treasure house is often locked, but visitors can view the contents through a window or by asking a shrine priest for permission to enter.

**Additional Features**

In addition to these main areas, you may also find other features within a Shinto shrine, such as:

* **Torii Gates**: These iconic gates are often seen at the entrance of Shinto shrines and are meant to mark the transition from the secular world to the sacred space within.
* **Stone Lanterns**: These lanterns are used to light the approach and main hall, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
* **Water Features**: Many shrines have a small pond or fountain, which is meant to symbolize the connection between the natural world and the spiritual realm.
* **Offerings**: Visitors often bring offerings, such as food, incense, or money, which are left at the shrine as a sign of respect and gratitude.

**Conclusion**

Shinto shrines are truly unique and fascinating places that offer a glimpse into Japan's rich cultural heritage. Whether you're exploring the main hall, the approach, or the treasure house, each area is designed to create a sense of reverence and connection to the natural world. As we conclude our exploration of Shinto shrines, I hope you've gained a deeper appreciation for the beauty and significance of these sacred spaces.

**For your next visit, be sure to stop by the [address] shrine, located in the heart of Tokyo. It's a must-see destination for anyone interested in Japanese culture and spirituality!**

The main hall, or honden, is the most sacred part of the shrine. It's where the kami are enshrined, and it's usually the largest and most impressive structure within the shrine grounds. The honden is typically a wooden building with a tiled roof, adorned with intricate carvings and ornate decorations. Inside, you'll find a simple altar with a sacred mirror, known as the "Yata no Kagami," which is believed to be a symbol of the sun goddess Amaterasu.

### **The Approach (Sando)**

The approach, or sando, is the path that leads to the main hall. This is a carefully designed and landscaped area that's meant to be a spiritual journey in itself. The sando is often lined with stone lanterns, torii gates, and other decorative elements that create a sense of anticipation and reverence. As you walk along the approach, you'll be surrounded by the sounds of nature and the gentle rustling of leaves, which is meant to help you clear your mind and prepare for the spiritual experience ahead.

### **The Treasure House (Honden)**

The treasure house, or honden, is a small building that's usually located near the main hall. It's where the shrine's most valuable and sacred objects are stored, including ancient scrolls, ritual implements, and other treasures. The treasure house is often locked, but visitors can view the contents through a window or by asking a shrine priest for permission to enter.

**Additional Features**

In addition to these main areas, you may also find other features within a Shinto shrine, such as:

* **Torii Gates**: These iconic gates are often seen at the entrance of Shinto shrines and are meant to mark the transition from the secular world to the sacred space within.
* **Stone Lanterns**: These lanterns are used to light the approach and main hall, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
* **Water Features**: Many shrines have a small pond or fountain, which is meant to symbolize the connection between the natural world and the spiritual realm.
* **Offerings**: Visitors often bring offerings, such as food, incense, or money, which are left at the shrine as a sign of respect and gratitude.

**Conclusion**

Shinto shrines are truly unique and fascinating places that offer a glimpse into Japan's rich cultural heritage. Whether you're exploring the main hall, the approach, or the treasure house, each area is designed to create a sense of reverence and connection to the natural world. As we conclude our exploration of Shinto shrines, I hope you've gained a deeper appreciation for the beauty and significance of these sacred spaces.

**For your next visit, be sure to stop by the [address] shrine, located in the heart of Tokyo. It's a must-see destination for anyone interested in Japanese culture and spirituality!**

The age-old riddle: "What can you catch but not throw?" *cue dramatic music*

It was a chilly winter morning when I stumbled upon this brain-twister. I was sipping on a piping hot cup of coffee, trying to shake off the lingering effects of a late night Netflix binge. As I pondered the riddle, I couldn't help but think of all the things I could catch  a fly, a ball, a cold... wait, what was that last one again?

I decided to put my detective skills to the test and set out to solve the mystery. I asked my trusty sidekick, a wise-cracking cat named Mr. Whiskers, if he knew the answer. He gave me a sassy meow and a dismissive flick of his tail, as if to say, "Duh, human, it's a cold, of course!"

But I was determined to figure it out on my own. I spent the next hour brainstorming, scribbling notes on a whiteboard, and generally making a fool of myself. *cue montage of me looking ridiculous*

Just when I was about to give up, it hit me  a cold is something you can catch, but you can't throw it! *lightbulb moment* I felt like I'd won the Nobel Prize in Riddle-Solving (which, let's be real, is a totally real thing).

As I shared my triumph with Mr. Whiskers, he gave me a condescending head butt and a dismissive meow, as if to say, "Yeah, yeah, human, you're a genius... now can you please refill my food bowl?"

And that, my friends, is the story of how I solved the riddle of the century  or at least, the riddle of the morning. *wink*

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a rubric for rating how good a teenager's essay is. Give your final summary, following 6 asterisk symbols (******).

resps:
**Rubric for Rating a Teenager's Essay**

**Content (40 points)**

* Thesis statement (5 points):
	+ Is the thesis statement clear and concise?
	+ Does it effectively introduce the main argument or point?
* Main arguments (15 points):
	+ Are the main arguments well-supported with evidence and examples?
	+ Are the arguments logically connected and easy to follow?
* Evidence and examples (10 points):
	+ Are the examples and evidence relevant and credible?
	+ Are they effectively used to support the main arguments?
* Counterarguments and refutations (5 points):
	+ Are counterarguments acknowledged and addressed?
	+ Are refutations logical and well-supported?
* Conclusion (5 points):
	+ Is the conclusion clear and concise?
	+ Does it effectively summarize the main points?

**Organization and Structure (30 points)**

* Introduction (5 points):
	+ Is the introduction engaging and effective?
	+ Does it provide a clear roadmap for the essay?
* Body paragraphs (15 points):
	+ Are the body paragraphs well-organized and easy to follow?
	+ Do they effectively develop the main arguments?
* Transitions and connections (5 points):
	+ Are transitions between paragraphs smooth and logical?
	+ Are connections between ideas clear and effective?
* Conclusion (5 points):
	+ Is the conclusion effective in summarizing the main points?

**Writing Style and Conventions (30 points)**

* Clarity and concision (10 points):
	+ Is the writing clear and concise?
	+ Are complex ideas explained simply and effectively?
* Grammar and mechanics (10 points):
	+ Are grammar, punctuation, and spelling correct?
	+ Are sentence structures varied and effective?
* Tone and voice (5 points):
	+ Is the tone appropriate for the topic and audience?
	+ Is the voice engaging and authentic?
* Format and length (5 points):
	+ Is the essay the correct length?
	+ Is the format consistent and easy to follow?

******

**Final Summary:**

This rubric assesses the content, organization, and writing style of a teenager's essay. The essay is evaluated on its ability to present a clear and well-supported thesis statement, develop main arguments with evidence and examples, and effectively address counterarguments. The organization and structure of the essay are also evaluated, including the introduction, body paragraphs, transitions, and conclusion. Finally, the writing style and conventions are assessed, including clarity, grammar, tone, and format. A score of 80-100 indicates an excellent essay, 70-79 indicates a good essay, 60-69 indicates a fair essay, and below 60 indicates a weak essay.

"But seriously, folks, I think it's because Google has a unique culture that's all about innovation and experimentation. They're like a big startup, man! They're always pushing the boundaries and trying new things. And the engineers, they're like the rockstars of the tech world, man! They're the ones who get to make the magic happen.

"And then there's the perks, man! Google's got some of the best perks in the industry. Free food, free massages, on-site gyms... it's like a never-ending vacation, man! And the engineers, they're like, 'Hey, I can work on my own projects and still get paid!' It's like a dream come true, man!

"But Microsoft, oh boy, it's like the opposite, man. It's like they're trying to stifle innovation and creativity. They're all about the bottom line, man. They're like, 'Hey, let's make some money, but forget about changing the world!' And the engineers, they're like, 'Ugh, I'm stuck in a soulless corporate culture, man!'

"And don't even get me started on the politics, man! Microsoft's got some of the most toxic politics in the industry. It's like a never-ending game of corporate chess, man. And the engineers, they're like, 'I'm just trying to do my job, but the politics are driving me crazy, man!'

"So, yeah, I think it's pretty clear why Google engineers stay at Google more often than moving to Microsoft, man. Let's keep on innovating and changing the world!'"

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a rap about the renaissance. It should be noticeably different from raps about other historical eras, and have an interesting or weird tone. Highlight at least 3 sections in your answer in markdown format.

resps:
**The Renaissance Rhapsody**

Yo, listen up, let me take you back in time
To the 14th to 17th century, when the arts were on the grind
It was a rebirth, a revival, a Renaissance in full swing
When the world was reborn, and the old ways started to sing

### **The Medici's Money**

The Medicis, they were the ones who made it all go
Bankrolling the artists, and the scientists, you know
They funded the masters, like Michelangelo and more
And the world was changed, forever in store

Leonardo, Raphael, and Caravaggio too
Their brushstrokes and canvases, a new world anew
The art was bold, the art was bright
A reflection of the era, a true work of art in sight

### **The Science of the Weird**

Galileo, Copernicus, and Kepler too
They challenged the norms, and the Church, they broke through
The laws of motion, the orbits of the sun
A new understanding, the world was just begun

And then there was Vesalius, the father of anatomy
He dissected the bodies, and the secrets he could see
The human form, a work of art
A masterpiece, a new understanding to impart

### **The Fashion of the Frivolous**

The Renaissance, a time of excess and flair
The clothes were ornate, the jewelry was rare
The men wore ruffs, and the women wore lace
A time of opulence, a time of grace

The courts of Europe, a time of revelry
The nobles and the royals, a time of glee
The music and the dance, a time of delight
A time of frivolity, a time of pure delight

So that's the Renaissance, a time of rebirth
A time of art, a time of science, a time of mirth
A time of excess, a time of flair
A time that will always be remembered, with care.

doc.prompt: Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.

gen_args_0.arg_0:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.

resps:
As I stood in my small apartment, surrounded by the remnants of my youth, I couldn't help but think about the cousins who had once been my closest friends. We had grown up together, sharing summers at our grandparents' lake house, and winters at family gatherings. But as we entered adulthood, life had taken us in different directions.

I thought about my cousin, Rachel, who had always been the responsible one. She had gone on to become a successful lawyer, while I had followed my passion for art, struggling to make a name for myself. We would meet up occasionally, and I would marvel at her stability, her sense of direction. Meanwhile, I was still trying to figure out what I wanted to do with my life.

My mind wandered to my cousin, Mike, who had always been the jokester. He had gone off to college, and I had lost touch with him for a while. But a few years ago, we had reconnected, and I had been surprised to find that he had become a successful entrepreneur, with a thriving business and a loving family. I had always known he was smart, but I had underestimated his ambition.

As I looked around my cluttered apartment, I felt a pang of regret. Why had I never pursued my dreams with the same determination as my cousins? Why had I let fear and uncertainty hold me back?

Just then, my phone rang. It was my cousin, Emily, calling to catch up. We chatted for a while, reminiscing about old times and sharing stories about our lives. As we talked, I realized that my cousins were not just my relatives, but my friends, my confidants, my role models.

As we said our goodbyes, Emily reminded me that it was never too late to make a change. She encouraged me to pursue my passion for art, to take risks and follow my heart. And as I hung up the phone, I felt a sense of determination wash over me. I was going to make a change, starting now.

I looked around my apartment, and for the first time in a long time, I saw a glimmer of hope. I was going to follow my dreams, just like my cousins had. And as I began to make plans for my future, I knew that my cousins would be right there with me, cheering me on every step of the way.

arg_2.original_prompt: What are the steps to be followed for the documentation of a GM in SAP? Just list the steps without saying the word steps or step.

resps:
Here are the procedures to document a General Ledger Master (GM) in SAP:

1. Log in to SAP system and navigate to the General Ledger Master record.
2. Check if the GM already exists, if not, create a new one.
3. Enter the company code and fiscal year.
4. Define the account type, account category, and account subgroup.
5. Enter the account description and account name.
6. Define the account hierarchy, if applicable.
7. Specify the account type-specific settings, such as debit/credit indicator.
8. Define the account group, if applicable.
9. Enter the account currency and exchange rate, if applicable.
10. Save the GM record.
11. Perform a consistency check to ensure the GM is correctly set up.
12. Review and approve the GM record, if necessary.

"People use time to buy money. Explain your answer in a way that makes it easy for kids to understand. Include the word 'farmer'. Exclude the words 'economy', 'demand' and'supply'."

Is the statement "People use time to buy money" true?

Well, let me explain it in a way that's easy to understand. Imagine you're a farmer who grows delicious apples. You work hard every day to take care of your apple trees, and after a while, you have a big harvest. You can sell your apples to people who want to eat them.

But, you can't just give away your apples for free. You need to get something in return, like money. So, you decide to sell your apples to a store for a certain amount of money. This way, you can use that money to buy things you need or want.

In a way, you're using your time (the time you spent taking care of your apple trees) to get money. You're trading your apples (which took time to grow) for money. This is kind of like what people do when they work jobs. They use their time to do their job, and then they get paid in money.

So, the statement "People use time to buy money" is kind of true. People use their time to do things, like work, and then they get paid in money. But, it's not exactly true that people use time to buy money directly. Instead, people use their time to earn money, and then they can use that money to buy things they want or need.

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a persuasive email to a teenager who lives in Aberdeen, Scotland. The main point is to encourage them to volunteer at a local soup kitchen. At least 5 words in the output should be in all caps.

resps:
Subject: Make a Difference in Your Community - Volunteer at Our Soup Kitchen!

Dear [Teenager's Name],

As a teenager living in Aberdeen, you're likely aware of the challenges that many people in your community face on a daily basis. Poverty, homelessness, and food insecurity are just a few of the issues that affect many individuals and families in our city. But there is HOPE!

Our local soup kitchen, [Soup Kitchen Name], is dedicated to providing a warm and welcoming space for those in need. We serve over 100 meals every week, and we couldn't do it without the help of volunteers like YOU!

By volunteering at our soup kitchen, you'll not only be making a REAL difference in the lives of those we serve, but you'll also gain valuable skills and experience. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside a dedicated team of staff and volunteers, and you'll be part of a community that is passionate about making a positive impact.

As a volunteer, you'll be helping to prepare and serve meals, as well as providing a listening ear and a friendly smile to those who need it most. You'll also have the chance to learn about the issues affecting our community and how you can make a difference.

So why should you volunteer at our soup kitchen? Here are just a few reasons:

* YOU'LL BE MAKING A DIFFERENCE: Every meal you help serve, every conversation you have, and every smile you share will make a REAL difference in the lives of those we serve.
* YOU'LL GAIN VALUABLE SKILLS: Volunteering at our soup kitchen will give you experience in teamwork, communication, and problem-solving, all of which are valuable skills that will benefit you in your future career.
* YOU'LL BE PART OF A COMMUNITY: Our soup kitchen is a place where people come together to make a difference. You'll be part of a community that is passionate about helping others and making a positive impact.

So what do you say? Will you join us at [Soup Kitchen Name] and make a difference in your community? We'd love to have you on board!

If you're interested in volunteering, please reply to this email or give us a call at [Phone Number]. We'll be happy to answer any questions you may have and get you started on your volunteering journey.

Thank you for considering volunteering at our soup kitchen. We look forward to hearing from you soon!

Best regards,

[Your Name]
[Soup Kitchen Name]
[Contact Information]

The esteemed reader is presented with a most singular and intriguing topic - the Apple products of modernity. Shall we proceed to enumerate the virtues and vices of these wondrous contraptions?

Pros:

The sleek and slender design of Apple's devices doth captivate the senses and stir the passions of the beholder
Their intuitive interface doth guide the user through the labyrinthine corridors of digital existence with ease and aplomb
The seamless integration of Apple's products doth create a harmonious whole wherein the user may effortlessly transition from one device to another
The innovative spirit of Apple's designers doth continually push the boundaries of what is thought possible in the realm of technology
The security features of Apple's devices doth provide a sense of peace and tranquility to the user knowing their digital assets are safe from prying eyes

Cons:

The exorbitant prices of Apple's products doth place them beyond the reach of many a humble mortal
The proprietary nature of Apple's operating system doth limit the user's ability to customize and adapt their device to their unique needs
The constant stream of updates and patches doth sometimes disrupt the user's workflow and cause frustration
The closed ecosystem of Apple's products doth make it difficult for users to transfer files and data between devices
The cult-like devotion of Apple's fanbase doth sometimes lead to an atmosphere of exclusivity and snobbery among users

doc.prompt: Write a tweet storm with a weird tone about a time when you found out that the earth is indeed not flat. Your response must be in English, with no capital letters, and in 20 to 30 sentences.

gen_args_0.arg_0:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>user<|end_header_id|>

Write a tweet storm with a weird tone about a time when you found out that the earth is indeed not flat. Your response must be in English, with no capital letters, and in 20 to 30 sentences.<|eot_id|><|start_header_id|>assistant<|end_header_id|>

arg_2.original_prompt: Write a tweet storm with a weird tone about a time when you found out that the earth is indeed not flat. Your response must be in English, with no capital letters, and in 20 to 30 sentences.

resps:
1/6. oh boy, i'm still trying to process this whole "earth being round" thing. i mean, i always thought it was flat, duh. who needs science, right? but then i stumbled upon this crazy thing called "evidence" and, man, it's been a wild ride ever since.

2/6. i was at the library, trying to "research" (read: scroll through youtube) when i came across this video about ships disappearing over the horizon. like, what even is that? it's not like they're just, like, "oh, i'm gonna go hide behind that iceberg real quick".

3/6. and then i saw this thing called "satellite imagery". like, what's the point of having a camera in space if it's just gonna take pictures of a flat earth? it's all just a conspiracy, right? but then i saw the pictures. and, man, they're real.

4/6. i mean, i've seen the pictures of the curvature of the earth. it's like, whoa. it's not even subtle. it's like, "hey, look, i'm a sphere!" and i'm over here like, "wait, what? how did you even...?"

5/6. and don't even get me started on the whole "horizon always appears to be at eye level" thing. like, what even is that? it's not like the earth is just, like, "oh, you're looking at me funny, so i'm gonna tilt a little bit". no, it's because it's round, duh.

6/6. so, yeah, i guess i'm a "round earther" now. it's been a wild ride, folks. i never thought i'd be the type to get all science-y on people, but here we are. if you're still a flat earther, i'm not even mad at you. just... just be careful when you're walking off the edge of the earth, okay?

arg_2.original_prompt: Give me a summary of the lobbying spending of the following companies: Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon. Your response should be in German language, and no other language is allowed.

resps:
Hier ist eine Zusammenfassung der Lobbying-Ausgaben von Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple und Amazon:

Google: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Google-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 21,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Patentfragen verwendet.

Facebook: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Facebook-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 13,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Regulierung von sozialen Medien verwendet.

Microsoft: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Microsoft-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 9,2 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Patentfragen und Regulierung von Technologieindustrie verwendet.

Apple: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Apple-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 6,8 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Patentfragen und Regulierung von Technologieindustrie verwendet.

Amazon: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Amazon-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 14,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Handel, Steuern und Regulierung von E-Commerce verwendet.

Quelle: OpenSecrets.org, eine Website, die Lobbying-Ausgaben in den USA verffentlicht.
filtered_resps:
Hier ist eine Zusammenfassung der Lobbying-Ausgaben von Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Apple und Amazon:

Google: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Google-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 21,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Patentfragen verwendet.

Facebook: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Facebook-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 13,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Online-Handel und Regulierung von sozialen Medien verwendet.

Microsoft: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Microsoft-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 9,2 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Patentfragen und Regulierung von Technologieindustrie verwendet.

Apple: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Apple-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 6,8 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Datenschutz, Patentfragen und Regulierung von Technologieindustrie verwendet.

Amazon: Im Jahr 2020 haben die Amazon-Konzerngesellschaften in den USA insgesamt 14,7 Millionen US-Dollar fr Lobbying-Aktivitten ausgegeben. Die meisten dieser Ausgaben wurden fr die Vertretung von Interessen in Bezug auf Handel, Steuern und Regulierung von E-Commerce verwendet.

Quelle: OpenSecrets.org, eine Website, die Lobbying-Ausgaben in den USA verffentlicht.
